com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.socket

Class SingletonServerSocketFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.net.ServerSocketFactory
      • com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.socket.SingletonServerSocketFactory

  • public class SingletonServerSocketFactory
extends javax.net.ServerSocketFactory
    Factory to create ServerSocket based on Connections which are optionally set. The default Connections configuration used is:
    • Acceptor queue size: 10
    • Handler queue size: 10
    • Drop after: 0
    • Drop on failed DNS lookup: false
    • Read buffer size: 1024
    A custom Connections configuration can be supplied via the withSocketConfigs(com.engineersbox.httpproxy.configuration.domain.servlet.Connections) method.

      Creates a ServerSocket with a binding to the supplied port, backlog from the queueSize and an address binding to interfaceAddress for a given InetAddress.
      SingletonServerSocketFactory withSocketConfigs(Connections connectionsConfig)

      • createServerSocket

        public java.net.ServerSocket createServerSocket(int port)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a ServerSocket with a binding to the supplied port.

        Additionally sets the SocketOptions.SO_TIMEOUT and SocketOptions.SO_RCVBUF options based on the set connectionsConfig.
        Specified by:
        createServerSocket in class javax.net.ServerSocketFactory
        Parameters:
        port - the port number, or 0 to use a port number that is automatically allocated
        Returns:
        ServerSocket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs whilst opening the socket

        See Also:
        ServerSocket.ServerSocket(int)

      • createServerSocket

        public java.net.ServerSocket createServerSocket(int port,
                                                int queueSize)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a ServerSocket with a binding to the supplied port and a backlog from the queueSize. Note that the queueSize is validated via the validateQueueSize(int) method.

        Additionally sets the SocketOptions.SO_TIMEOUT and SocketOptions.SO_RCVBUF options based on the set connectionsConfig.
        Specified by:
        createServerSocket in class javax.net.ServerSocketFactory
        Parameters:
        port - the port number, or 0 to use a port number that is automatically allocated
        Returns:
        ServerSocket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs whilst opening the socket

        See Also:
        ServerSocket.ServerSocket(int, int)

      • createServerSocket

        public java.net.ServerSocket createServerSocket(int port,
                                                int queueSize,
                                                java.net.InetAddress interfaceAddress)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a ServerSocket with a binding to the supplied port, backlog from the queueSize and an address binding to interfaceAddress for a given InetAddress. Note that the queueSize is validated via the validateQueueSize(int) method.

        Additionally sets the SocketOptions.SO_TIMEOUT and SocketOptions.SO_RCVBUF options based on the set connectionsConfig.
        Specified by:
        createServerSocket in class javax.net.ServerSocketFactory
        Parameters:
        port - the port number, or 0 to use a port number that is automatically allocated
        Returns:
        ServerSocket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs whilst opening the socket

        See Also:
        ServerSocket.ServerSocket(int, int, InetAddress)
